englishTranslationText: For	them	is	the	sustenance	known	to	Us.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	ke	liye	woh	rozi	hai	jo	hamāre	‘ilm	meiñ	
hai.

englishTranslationText: Fruits;	and	they	will	be	honoured.

romanUrduTranslationText: Takhtoñ	par	hoñ	ge	āamne	sāmne.

englishTranslationText: Cups	of	wine	will	be	presented	to	them	in	rounds,	from	a	spring	flowing	in	front	of	them.
romanUrduTranslationText: Un	par	daura	hogā	nigāh	ke	sāmne	bahti	sharāb	ke	jām	kā.
Safed	rang	pine	wāloñ	ke	liye	laƶƶat.

arabicText: لَا فِيهَا غَوْلٌۭ وَلَا هُمْ عَنْهَا يُنزَفُونَ
englishTranslationText: Neither	does	it	intoxicate,	nor	give	a	headache.
romanUrduTranslationText: Na	us	meiñ	khumār	hai	aur	na	us	se	un	kā	sar	phire.

englishTranslationText:
And	with	them	are	those	who	do	not	set	gaze	upon	men	except	their	husbands,	the	maidens	
with	gorgeous	eyes.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	un	ke	pās	haiñ	jo	shauharoñ	ke	siwā	doosri	ṭaraf	āañkh	uthā	kar	na	dekheñ	gi	badi	āañkhoñ	
wāliyāñ.

englishTranslationText: As	if	they	were	eggs,	safely	hidden.
romanUrduTranslationText: Goyā	woh	ande	haiñ	poshida	rakhe	huye.

englishTranslationText: So	one	among	them	turns	to	the	other,	questioning.	-
romanUrduTranslationText: To	un	meiñ	aik	ne	doosre	ki	ṭaraf	muñh	kiyā	poochte	huye.

arabicText: قَالَ قَآئِلٌۭ مِّنْهُمْ إِنِّى كَانَ لِى قَرِينٌۭ
englishTranslationText: The	speaker	among	them	said,	“I	had	a	companion.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Un	meiñ	se	kahne	wālā	bola	merā	aik	ham	nashin	thā.

englishTranslationText:
“Who	used	to	tell	me,	‘Do	you	believe	it	is	
true?’
romanUrduTranslationText:
Mujh	se	kahā	kartā	kyā	tum	isey	sach	
mānte	ho.
